itemDescription: British mathematician, theoretical physicist, academic administrator and architectural historian

wikipedia_page.main: Harold McCarter Taylor,  (13 May 1907 – 23 October 1995) was a New Zealand-born British mathematician, theoretical physicist and academic administrator, but is best known as a historian of architecture and the author, with his first wife Joan Taylor, née Sills, of the three volumes of Anglo-Saxon Architecture, published between 1965 and 1978.
